meanings.definition: A low story between two higher stories in a building, especially when the low story and the one beneath it form part of one composition.
meanings.sent1: The entresols in the old building were cozy spaces between the main floors.
meanings.sent2: The architect included entresols in the design to add extra living areas.
meanings.sent3: During the game of hide-and-seek, the children discovered the entresols and giggled with excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like entresols, nestled between memories of the past and dreams of the future.
meanings.sent5: The entresols, with their dim lighting and unique charm, became the favorite spots for quiet reading.
